tweets.text:
#URGENT!
Based on preliminary data, #Azerbaijan used banned white phosphorus munitions over #Artsakh/#Karabakh causing fires to forests next to civilian communities.
In addition to #ecological disaster they aim at burning the people hidden in the forests. https://t.co/dp4xYy0Mx5
#azeriwarcrimes this is despicable. How can you claim these are your lands if all you want to do is destroy them https://t.co/sztmsDJcx2

NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ

Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

Never seen a nutrient problem quite like this. Three sewage works and one village on septic tanks feeding one small stream. The #Wensum dying from the top down. https://t.co/cxV04qKrMm

@ThamesPathNT @emilyjanelovell @ThamesEstPart @EnvAgencySE @LondonPortAuth @Thames21 @eveasanders Wow! That's an amazing photo! The Estuary Edge reed bed and Thames foreshore look particularly lovely üíô

21 containers of illegally exported waste sent to Sri Lanka have successfully returned to England.

We will investigate who exported this #WasteCrime. 

Those responsible could face 2 years in prison, and an unlimited fine.

Read more here: https://t.co/ti1Wt6XYYP https://t.co/a347mSYEpi

"Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. They must have realised by now that they've got a major liability on the hands and it's called the @EnvAgency. 

 https://t.co/SAVei8xunt

Do you use cotton balls, pads or buds?

Never put them down the loo as they don't break down like toilet paper, causing blockages and harming our environment.

To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper.

#Unblocktober https://t.co/utmNK3x3jp

If you've not caught it already, give your ears and minds a treat with a #LondonRiversWeek2020 @ThamesEstPart podcast special with me and lovely colleagues from @Thames21 @EnvAgency @SE_Rivers_Trust thanks to our talented Estuary Edges officer @eveasanders üåäüíôüëá https://t.co/B9bWxPUe47

For #LondonRiversWeek2020, we have a brand new #TalkoftheThames podcast!
 
This special edition discusses the key messages of London Rivers Week with a panel of speakers from across the Thames Estuary including from @Thames21 @EnvAgency @SE_Rivers_Trust! 
https://t.co/2Cq93B9k8s https://t.co/UCnQE2XxfA

This sends a powerful message. It‚Äôs value has not diminished.  In fact it now has more relevance than ever as despite evidence of disturbance to bat colonies @NorfolkCC has still failed to mitigate ongoing injury/death Thanks again to @joe_crowley https://t.co/UYNws5Mnvx https://t.co/xDMvU581Ez

@thameswater @SE_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @UnderwaterMedia @sascampaigns @AquiferChalk I'm sure you'll agree a Chalk Stream shouldn't be this colour I've witnessed this at least 5 times is the past few weeks and reported it every time to the @EnvAgency

@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.

"Exceptional circumstance"? https://t.co/trky5H39u8

Last chance to register for the #NORA3 conference taking place online AM 4th & 5th Nov. https://t.co/r9wD7ufoVo. Excited to be launching @LIFEprogramme and @EnvAgency supported @NORA_Europe and @NativeOysterNet collaborative efforts. Join us for marine #OceanOptimism. Please RT.

Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi

Our Officers are talking to residents, clearing grids and checking assets across the North West in preparation of the heavy showers expected over the next few days. #beprepared and make sure to check if you‚Äôre at risk: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/nLKdyDqBcQ
"Rivers of Shame". https://t.co/2CbDV0ePK1

Carrying out maintenance works today for @EnvAgencyYNE on Fleet Drain in Hessle with some of our specialist equipment to operate safely and efficiently in poor weather conditions @SpearheadWorld @McConnelPower @Energreensrl https://t.co/IClCW1j5Xr

tweets.text:
It can take less than 2 minutes to sign up to the @EnvAgency's free #FloodWarning service.

Please take care this weekend and check the #flood forecast here: https://t.co/ZNhevgqGwx https://t.co/gZV9LeBotm

With the work to divert part of the #RiverTrent in #Stoke-on-Trent almost finished, today our biodiversity team has been in the river rescuing fish before the new channel is finally connected. #StaffsSUNRISE @WildStoke @StaffsWT @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/MKf6emYUEA
What‚Äôs a 3D Buffer Zone? How do I get one? How will it address water quality and wider issues? See our report: https://t.co/f1JhkdWVfl @EnvAgency @Forest_Research https://t.co/603nn9z0GH
@EnvAgencyAnglia @AllFishOnTheFly Therefore a complete waste of time please stick to pursuing the river polluters

We have been out checking fishing licences in Suffolküêü

17 anglers were checked at Alton Water Park and they all had licencesüëç 

Make sure you are also legal by purchasing a fishing licence here: https://t.co/EL8RJbio0s #Fishing #Suffolk https://t.co/XqnjcWEq89

@GawRagbag @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV WASP is working with the Coln. It's about 5 years behind the Windrush in destruction but catching up fast. Ampney Brook also falling fast. Looking for satellite monitors for these rivers.

Heavy üåßÔ∏è is expected across the #NorthWest over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to reduce #flood risk to communties. 

Today, they have been at Frodsham Pumping Station #Cheshire clearing grids of potential blockages. 

Are you prepared? https://t.co/bzqwakH8X8 https://t.co/AbQz0gDcNR

https://t.co/mRheMzm4z1

@seasonalight @jamespearson88 @NickyGeeson @EnvAgencyMids We‚Äôre not trying to catch farmers out and advice is almost always first course of action.

However, some have received guidance but practice hasn‚Äôt changed.

@jamespearson88 @NickyGeeson @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA education, please, and then enforcement. It really worries me that without best info networks, farmers just feel got-at, and then go the other way. I write about river ecology and I grew up here.

@riverstourward @jamespearson88 @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA Hi Andrew. Is that a field of post harvest potatoes? What advise are you giving to farmers to stop this from happening in these conditions? That one doesnt even look like the bottom of the hill.
